::::{.cr-section layout="overlay-center"}

Get your first closeread doc up and running in five steps.

Step one: create a qmd file and set the format to closeread-html. [@cr-doc1]{highlight="3"}

:::{#cr-doc1 filename="myfirstcr.qmd"}
````markdown
---
title: My First Closeread
format: closeread-html
---

Hello World! Please read my closeread story below.
````
:::

Step two: open up a closeread section. [@cr-doc2]{highlight="8-10"}

:::{#cr-doc2 filename="myfirstcr.qmd"}
````markdown
---
title: My First Closeread
format: closeread-html
---

Hello World! Please read my closeread story below.

:::{.cr-section}

:::

````
:::

Step three: fill the section with elements to study as well as narrative. [@cr-doc3]{highlight="9-11"}

:::{#cr-doc3 filename="myfirstcr.qmd"}
````markdown
---
title: My First Closeread
format: closeread-html
---

Hello World! Please read my closeread story below.

:::{.cr-section}
Closeread is a Quarto extension that enables scrollytelling.

![](quarto-logo.png)
:::

````
:::
::::

Closeread is a Quarto extension that allows you to author scrollytelling HTML documents. To learn how to create your first closeread document, start off by reading about the [Components of a Closeread Document](components.qmd).
